ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class UltrasonicLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.UltrasonicLocalizer

  • public class UltrasonicLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
    The UltrasonicLocalizer implements two different types of localization methods which use an ultrasonic sensor.The two types of localizations include falling edge (when robot starts by facing away from the wall) and rising edge (when robot starts by facing the wall).
    Author:
    Dimitrios Sinodinos, Jacob St-Laurent

      • UltrasonicLocalizer

        public UltrasonicLocalizer()

    • Method Detail

      • getFilteredDistance

        public double getFilteredDistance()
        Takes the average of a SAMPLING_SIZE number of samples from the ultrasonic sensor distance readings.
        Returns:
        average of SAMPLING_SIZE number of distance samples.

      • localize

        public void localize()
        Localize is used for the initial localization. It will call the appropriate localization technique based on the starting orientation of the robot.

      • relocalize

        public void relocalize()
        Relocalize is used to localize the robot after it has already starting moving. This method readjusts the X and Y values by by turning to 180 and 270 degrees and measuring the corresponding distance values.
